intro: Bolbophyllaria oerstedii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with a short stem and dense foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Bolbophyllaria oerstedii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
